required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Different Electrical Currents on Pressure Pain Threshold and Sensory Comfort.
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Effects of Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation, Aussie Current and Interferential Current on Pressure Pain Threshold and Sensory Comfort in Healthy Humans.

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to compare the hypoalgesic effects of TENS, Interferential current and Aussie current in pressure pain threshold and sensory discomfort in healthy subjects.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 15 minutes after the beginning of electrical stimulation, 30 minutes after the beginning of electrical stimulation, and 20 minutes after electrical stimulation.
primary_outcome.description: Pressure Pain Threshold will be measured using a pressure algometer (Kratos). The applied force will be measured in Newton (N).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 and 30 minutes after the beginning of electrical stimulation.
secondary_outcome.description: Sensory Discomfort will be measured using a 10 cm visual analogue scale (VAS). The degree of discomfort will be measured in centimeters (cm).

arm_group.description: This group will not receive electrical stimulation. Volunteers will rest during 30 minutes.
Interferential current will be applied during 30 minutes to volunteer's forearm. Intensity will be increase until volunteers fell a strong but comfortable paresthesia.
TENS will be applied during 30 minutes to volunteer's forearm. Intensity will be increase until volunteers fell a strong but comfortable paresthesia.
Aussie current will be applied during 30 minutes to volunteer's forearm. Intensity will be increase until volunteers fell a strong but comfortable paresthesia.

intervention.description: Interferential current will be applied during 30 minutes to volunteer's forearm at a strong but comfortable intensity. Carrier frequency will be set at 4 kilohertz (kHz) and modulated frequency will be set at 50 Hz.
Aussie current will be applied during 30 minutes to volunteer's forearm at a strong but comfortable intensity. Carrier frequency will be set at 4 kHz and modulated frequency will be set at 50 Hz.
TENS will be applied during 30 minutes to volunteer's forearm at a strong but comfortable intensity. Pulse duration will be set at 125 microseconds and frequency will be set at 50 Hz.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- health adults
Exclusion Criteria:
- injury to nerves of the upper limbs, pain, pregnancy, chronic diseases, cardiac pacemaker, epilepsy, allergy to the electrode used, use of pain medication, skin lesions or lack of sensitivity in the areas of electrode placement
